definition: oath/pledge/union/to ally/league, a subdivision corresponding to prefecture in Inner Mongolia
Tongmenghui, Sun Yat-sen's alliance for democracy, founded 1905, became the Guomindang 國民黨|国民党 in 1912
Tongmenghui, Sun Yat-sen's alliance for democracy, founded 1905, became the Guomindang 國民黨|国民党 in 1912

pinyin: Zhong1 guo2 Min2 zhu3 Tong2 meng2
Tai2 wan1 Min2 zhu3 Zi4 zhi4 Tong2 meng2

sentences.english: Australia invoked the treaty to come to our defense.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亞援引同盟條約來保衛我們。

sentences.english: Experts in the U.S. and allied governments find these denials hard to believe.
sentences.chinese: 美國及其同盟國的專家覺得這些聲明不值得相信。

sentences.english: France is one of the member states of the ELL.
sentences.chinese: 法國事歐羅巴洲同盟成員國之一。

sentences.english: Once the Alliance was truly formed, Mothma wrote the "Declaration of Rebellion."
sentences.chinese: 同盟一旦真正成立，莫思瑪就寫了《起義宣言》。

sentences.english: Many of his world-mates also served as Alliance starfighter pilots in the battle.
sentences.chinese: 他的許多同胞也在戰鬥中擔任同盟星際戰鬥機飛行員。

sentences.english: The closer relationship between Japan and South Korea will also reinforce the Japan-US alliance.
sentences.chinese: 而更親近的日韓關係，也將夯實日美同盟。

sentences.english: The ally of the working class was the peasantry.
sentences.chinese: 工人階級的同盟軍是農民階級。

sentences.english: The Kuomintang government to sign a peace treaty with Japan and join the triple alliance.
sentences.chinese: 民黨政府同日本訂立和平條約，加入三國同盟。

sentences.english: In 1906 he met Mr. Sun Yat-sen in Japan and joined the Chinese Revolutionary League.
sentences.chinese: 1906年他在日本得會孫中山，並加入同盟會。

sentences.english: She also pledged to rebuild Washington's alliances in Europe and Asia.
sentences.chinese: 她還表示要重建華盛頓在歐洲和亞洲的同盟。

sentences.english: Their plan worked and the city was eventually liberated by the Alliance.
sentences.chinese: 他們的計劃取得了成功，雲城最後被義軍同盟解放。

sentences.english: It was the Rightist Chang-Lo alliance that wanted us to go backward .
sentences.chinese: 要促退我們的，是那個右派章羅同盟。

sentences.english: The British North America Act made this Confederation legal.
sentences.chinese: 英屬北美條約令同盟合法。

sentences.english: Obama and Kan are expected to reaffirm the importance of the U.S.-Japan alliance.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬和菅直人預計將重申美日同盟的重要性。

sentences.english: China and Pakistan are close diplomatic allies.
sentences.chinese: 中國和巴基斯坦系外交關係密切的同盟國。

sentences.english: Others have used their political allies to squeeze out foreign partners.
sentences.chinese: 其他的一些公司動用政治同盟排擠外國合作伙伴。

definition: to form an alliance/to ally oneself with/allied with/aligned/to bond with
contract of alliance/oath or treaty between allies
expeditionary force/army on a distant expedition
a front (militant group)/line of battle/alignment (towards a political party etc)
